title: Alia Bhatt Might Make Her Tollywood Debut Soon, And Mentor Karan Johar Might Have Something To Do With It
text:
facebook 434 SHARES 
Alia Bhatt, who was reportedly all set to take a hiatus from acting, might have her break cut short thanks to her father, Mahesh Bhatt, and Bollywood's big daddy, Karan Johar. If rumours are true, the two have been approached by their Tollywood friend Akkineni Nagarjuna, better known as Nagarjuna, for his son Akhil's second film. After Akhil's somewhat unsuccessful debut, Nagarjuna is pulling all strings possible to make sure his next venture is a hit, and is even producing it himself. 
Regardless, the film, which was earlier set to star Megha Akash, is now in hot water because Megha is no longer available to shoot the film. So, reports suggest Akhil is keen on roping in Alia for the part, and is using his father's friendship with Mahesh Bhatt to get the job done. 
Akhil Akkineni 
However, Sanjay Dutt had earlier tried to rope in Alia for his film, Bhoomi , through similar means, but in vain. This time, though, KJo's involvement in the matter increases the chances of Alia doing the project, as KJo launched her into the industry, and has always been her mentor. Plus, with only Ranbir Kapoor-starrer, Dragon , in her kitty, Alia doesn't have much on her plate. Already chilling in London with her buddies, we wonder if Alia is ready to jump back in the game, and that too down south. Picture credits: Thinikstock and Getty Images, Chitramala
